{"body": {"name": "Near Brazil + Partner: Tech Academy - From Basic to Advanced", "summary": "This proposal outlines the creation of a 2-4 month academy focused on Near technology, aiming to address the critical shortage of skilled developers in Brazil. This initiative, a collaborative effort between Near Brazil team and Partner, a social impact education organization, will equip participants with the necessary skills to develop innovative solutions and contribute to the Near ecosystem\\\\\\'s growth.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "### Proposal: Near Brazil + Partner -> Tech Academy - from Basic to Advanced\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### Short Description:\\\\n\\\\nAn 2 to 4-month academy focusing on Near technology represents a pivotal strategic initiative to accelerate the adoption and expansion of the Near ecosystem. This academy will not only provide access to high-quality educational curriculum tailored to the nuances and specific applications of Near blockchain technology but will also act as a catalyst for nurturing new proficient developers within this platform. By offering comprehensive training that spans from basic to advanced concepts, participants will gain the necessary skills to innovate and make significant contributions to the ecosystem. Furthermore, this initiative is poised to foster a stronger and more diverse developer community, empowering professionals to tackle complex challenges and develop innovative decentralized solutions. The expected impact includes not only enlarging the talent pool of technically adept individuals to work with Near but also strengthening the network, promoting innovation, and accelerating the adoption of blockchain technologies across various industries.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### Context of the Proposal:\\\\n\\\\nNear Development Academy in Partnership between Near Brazil team and Partner\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### Introduction:\\\\n\\\\nWith the number of developers in Brazil increasing and the country positioning itself as an expanding market in the blockchain technology scene, emerging technologies such as Solana, Avalanche, Ethereum, Cosmos, and Polygon view Brazil as fertile ground for innovation and adoption. However, a common challenge faced by all these technologies is the scarcity of qualified developers or a solid base of developers familiar with their specific programming languages and SDKs.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### The Need:\\\\n\\\\nWe have identified a critical need to expand the base of skilled developers in Brazil, not just to meet current demand but also to position the country as a leader in the development of innovative blockchain solutions. The programming language Rust, along with Near\\\\\\'s SDK, are specific areas where the demand for skills significantly exceeds supply.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### The Proposal: Near Development Academy:\\\\n\\\\nIn response to this need, the Near Brazil team, in conjunction with the Technological Training School Partner, proposes the creation of an academy dedicated to attracting and training developers in Near technology. This program aims to equip participants with knowledge ranging from the basics of programming and algorithms to advanced development in Rust, using Near\\\\\\'s SDK.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### Program Objectives:\\\\n\\\\nThe program aims to train 100 developers highly skilled in Near technology, divided into teaching modalities:\\\\n\\\\n- **Online:** Targeted at 75 participants, offering flexibility and accessibility for those unable to participate in person.\\\\n- **In-person:** Providing 25 spots for those who prefer or benefit more from a classroom learning experience.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### Expected Impact:\\\\n\\\\nThe initiative seeks not only to fill the existing gap of qualified developers in emerging blockchain technologies in Brazil but also to stimulate innovation and the development of projects that can place the country at the forefront of blockchain technology. By doing so, we aim to contribute significantly to economic and technological growth and position Brazil as a center of excellence in blockchain.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### Importance for Business and Partnerships:\\\\n\\\\nThis initiative is also critically important for businesses and the establishment of partnerships with companies looking to develop on Near and its ecosystem. By creating a skilled pool of developers familiar with Near\\\\\\'s technology, we are enabling the foundation for robust business collaborations and innovative projects. Partnerships with companies are essential for applying the developed skills in real-world scenarios, thereby fostering the growth of the Near ecosystem and providing tangible benefits to the Brazilian economy through technology transfer, job creation, and enhanced technological capabilities.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### Conclusion:\\\\n\\\\nThe collaboration between Near Brazil team and Partner represents a strategic and innovative step to address the challenge of the shortage of qualified developers in Brazil. With a clear focus on developing competencies in Rust, this academy promises not only to train the next generation of blockchain experts in Brazil but also to open doors for new technological and economic development opportunities in the country. This effort will be pivotal in enhancing business opportunities and fostering partnerships that will drive the future of blockchain technology in Brazil and beyond.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### Problem Statement:\\\\n\\\\nWho does this solution help?\\\\nWhy Brazil?\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nBrazil has stood as one of the world\\\\\\'s leading economies, and in 2022, the country\\\\\\'s Gross Domestic Product (GDP) amounted to a staggering BRL 9.9 trillion. This figure reflects the sum of all wealth produced within Brazilian territory during that year, underscoring Brazil\\\\\\'s importance on the global economic stage.\\\\n\\\\nLooking at the latest data, we can see that in the first quarter of 2023, Brazil\\\\\\'s GDP reached BRL 2,556.5 billion. This suggests that the Brazilian economy maintained a strong and steady pace of growth, which is a positive sign for the future.\\\\n\\\\nBeing present at flagship blockchain events such as Blockchain Rio helps the overall Near ecosystem, increasing the brand visibility and providing opportunities for ecosystem growth.\\\\n\\\\nThe primary target audience consists of developers of all levels and builders/startups (founders and CTOs/technical decision-makers).\\\\n\\\\nAccording to new data released by the Federal Revenue Service, Brazil now has almost 10 million cryptocurrency investors, the highest number since the agency began receiving declarations of digital assets from individuals and brokers based in the country.\\\\n\\\\nIn the report for the month of April, the Revenue registered 1,996,165 CPFs (Brazilian individual taxpayer registry identification) involved in crypto transactions, 19.2% more than in March. The number of CNPJs (National Registry of Legal Entities) also increased: for the first time, it surpassed 65,000.\\\\n\\\\nThe growth occurred amid a broad recovery of Bitcoin in the first months of the year. Now, the digital currency rose strongly and briefly reached $30,000, almost a 100% increase compared to its worst moment in 2022, in November.\\\\n\\\\nBrazil, the largest and most populated country in Latin America, has emerged as a significant player in digital and financial technology, fueled by its young median age of 32 and high mobile and internet usage rates. The country boasts around 212 million inhabitants and is ranked fifth globally in terms of cryptocurrency ownership. Brazil is the fifth largest cryptocurrency market on the planet, behind only India, USA, Russia, and Nigeria, as shown by the study carried out by Binance and TripleA. Currently, more than 10 million Brazilians invest in assets, already surpassing the approximately 4 million Brazilian investors in B3 (like nasdaq and sp500 for brazilians).\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### Developers in Brazil:\\\\n\\\\nThe software developer community in Brazil is one of the most vibrant and rapidly growing in the world, reflecting the growing importance of technology and innovation in the Brazilian economy and society. With a robust technological ecosystem, Brazil has stood out not only in Latin America but globally as a significant hub for information technology talent and software development.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### Size and Growth:\\\\n\\\\nAlthough specific figures may vary according to different sources, it is estimated that Brazil has over 400,000 software developers, with forecasts indicating continued growth in this number. This is partly due to investments in technological education and the increasing interest of younger generations in technology-related careers.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### Education and Training:\\\\n\\\\nBrazil boasts a strong network of higher education and technical institutions offering courses related to information technology, including software development, computer science, and computer engineering. Additionally, there\\\\\\'s a proliferation of bootcamps, online courses, and training programs that facilitate the rapid development of specific programming and technology skills, enabling more people to enter the profession.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### Communities and Events:\\\\n\\\\nThe Brazilian developer community is highly engaged, with numerous events, conferences, meetups, and hackathons regularly held across the country. These events not only provide learning and professional development opportunities but also foster collaboration, networking, and innovation.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### Technologies and Areas of Focus:\\\\n\\\\nBrazilian developers work with a wide range of technologies, from popular programming languages like JavaScript, Python, and Java, to emerging technologies such as blockchain, artificial intelligence, and the Internet of Things (IoT). There is a particular interest in software solutions for fintechs, agritech, healthtech, and edtech, reflecting the unique needs and opportunities of the Brazilian market.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### Challenges and Opportunities:\\\\n\\\\nDespite the growth and dynamism of the community, there are still challenges to overcome, such as the need for greater diversity and inclusion in the tech sector and bridging specific skill gaps. However, the outlook for software developers in Brazil remains positive, with increasing demand for qualified professionals both in the domestic market and in global projects.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\nIn summary, the software developer community in Brazil is a crucial component of the country\\\\\\'s technological ecosystem, playing a key role in innovation and economic development. With ongoing investments in education, training, and technological infrastructure, Brazil is well-positioned to continue its growth and impact on the global technology scene.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### Why Not a Tech Academy in English?\\\\n\\\\nThe establishment of a Tech Academy in Brazil, offering courses and training in Portuguese, is crucial given the current linguistic landscape of the country. Data reveal that only 5% of the Brazilian population speaks English, and a mere 1% are fluent in the language, according to a study by the British Council. This linguistic reality presents significant barriers to accessing technical knowledge and the latest developments in the tech sector, which are predominantly disseminated in English. Below, I discuss the main reasons why a Tech Academy in Portuguese is important in Brazil:\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### Democratization of Access to Technological Knowledge:\\\\n\\\\nA Tech Academy operating in Portuguese can democratize access to technological knowledge, allowing more Brazilians, regardless of their proficiency in English, to learn about programming, software development, artificial intelligence, among other relevant topics. This is especially important in a country with as much diversity and socioeconomic inequality as Brazil.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### Stimulation of Innovation and Local Development:\\\\n\\\\nBy offering technological training in Portuguese, a Tech Academy can stimulate innovation and the development of technological solutions tailored to local needs. This not only contributes to the strengthening of the startup and technology ecosystem in the country but also promotes the solving of social problems through technology\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nStimulation of Innovation and Local Development\\\\n\\\\nBy offering technological training in Portuguese, a Tech Academy can stimulate innovation and the development of technological solutions tailored to local needs. This not only contributes to the strengthening of the startup and technology ecosystem in the country but also promotes the solving of social problems through technology.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nSocial and Economic Inclusion\\\\n\\\\nAccessible technological training in the Portuguese language can be a powerful tool for social and economic inclusion, empowering individuals from different social strata to enter the growing technological labor market. This can help reduce economic disparities and promote a more equitable society.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nDevelopment of Local Talents\\\\n\\\\nWith the linguistic barrier mitigated, a Tech Academy in Portuguese can help identify and develop local talents, which might otherwise remain untapped. This is crucial for Brazil, which needs to expand its base of qualified technology professionals to compete globally and for the country\\\\\\'s sustainable development.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nStrengthening of the Digital Economy\\\\n\\\\nTraining more technology professionals in their native language is strategic for strengthening the Brazilian digital economy. With more developers, data scientists, and information technology specialists trained within the country, Brazil can better position itself as a leader in technological innovation in Latin America and the world.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nIn summary, the creation of a Tech Academy in Portuguese is essential to overcome the linguistic barriers that limit access to knowledge and opportunities in the tech sector. This initiative can facilitate the inclusion of a larger number of Brazilians in the dynamic technology market, in addition to contributing to the socio economic and technological development of the country.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### About Partner\\\\n\\\\nPartner is an edtech initiative created by experienced professionals in the technology market. Their mission is to transform lives and empower individuals through quality education focused on web3 technologies and the current job market demands.\\\\n\\\\nThe program selects individuals from underserved communities and equips them with the skills needed to thrive.  The intensive training program lasts from 6 to 10 months and covers a wide range of subjects, including:\\\\n\\\\n* Programming logic and Python programming\\\\n* Financial literacy and family planning\\\\n* Market types and soft skills development \\\\n* Entrepreneurship and effective study techniques\\\\n* Current technologies with an emphasis on web3 and blockchain applications\\\\n\\\\nPartner boasts an impressive KPI of 85% placement rate for graduates, securing them employment in technology companies.  The program goes beyond technical skills training, fostering personal transformation and preparing individuals to apply their knowledge in various aspects of their lives.\\\\n\\\\nFunding for the program comes from corporate and individual investments, which cover operational costs such as facilities, staff, educational materials, transportation, meals, and classroom equipment. \\\\n\\\\nTheir vision extends beyond education. They are actively participating in web3 projects, developing on-chain and off-chain solutions, dapps, metaverse experiences, and educational tools within this domain.\\\\n\\\\nThe program targets individuals from at-risk communities who are committed to a complete life transformation.  The initiative empowers them to not only improve their own lives but also to positively influence their families, friends, and communities. Partner equips students with the essential skill of learning itself, through immersive experiences, industry expert lectures, assigned readings, hackathons, and their unique educational methodology.\\\\n\\\\nMain Objectives with the Partner\\\\\\'s Program:\\\\n\\\\n- Empower young people and adults to work and undertake in web3;\\\\n\\\\n- Create conditions for students to take on the role of active agents of change in their communities and surroundings in general;\\\\n\\\\n- Use web3 technologies in their daily lives;\\\\n\\\\n- Prepare professionals for the Web3 and new technologies job market;\\\\n\\\\n- Understand business possibilities with web3;\\\\n\\\\n- Develop an innovative mindset in web3 and in any area that uses technology.\\\\n\\\\nThe entire program is FREE. Selected students receive daily transportation and snacks throughout the course. For this, we rely on donations and investments from private companies, not only in capital but also in materials for use in the classroom or for students who cannot afford the basics to maintain their studies at home.\\\\n\\\\nClasses throughout the program are in-person, with the addition of online classes, lectures, attending events, hackathons, immersions, visits to technology companies, innovation fostering, workshops, and more.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### 3.2 Class Journey\\\\n\\\\nMethodology\\\\n\\\\nOnline Classes\\\\n\\\\na) Recorded classes lasting 60 to 90 minutes, focusing on the modules of the subjects presented in the educational journey of the Partner formation. These classes will initially be stored in an unlisted YouTube channel and later on a platform that we are in the process of choosing for hosting. These classes will be accessible to students at any time for review or to revisit the steps presented there.\\\\n\\\\nb) Weekly masterclasses for addressing doubts and deepening the material. These masterclasses will be live with teachers who are experts in the subject.\\\\n\\\\nc) AI mentor will be fed with the content of our course and constantly updated with curated material from our team.\\\\n\\\\nd) Specific areas will be created on the Near Brasil Discord server for the students and their tasks, supported by our team and AI mentor.\\\\n\\\\ne) Bi-weekly masterclasses of 60 minutes with extra challenges for students who wish to deepen their understanding of the subject.\\\\n\\\\nf) File repository with exercise solutions and extra material curated by our team.\\\\n\\\\nFace-to-face classes\\\\n\\\\na) The face-to-face classes will be held in our classroom space with a capacity of up to 25 students. The space includes 25 machines, high-speed internet access, and a smart board.\\\\n\\\\nb) Classes will take place from Tuesday to Friday during an 8-month journey for this group, in the afternoon from 2 PM to 5 PM.\\\\n\\\\nc) All teaching materials will be created by partner team based on Near materials, combined with pedagogical methodology developed by Partner.\\\\n\\\\nd) AI mentor will be fed with the content of our course and constantly updated with curated material from our team.\\\\n\\\\ne) Specific areas will be created on the Near Brasil Discord server for the students and their tasks, supported by our team and our AI mentor.\\\\n\\\\nf) Bi-weekly masterclasses of 60 minutes with extra challenges for students who wish to deepen their understanding of the subject.\\\\n\\\\ng) File repository with exercise solutions and extra material curated by our team.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### Partner Academy - Near Journey\\\\n\\\\nIntroduction to Blockchain\\\\nBlockchain Fundamentals\\\\nWeb3 Development Tools and Libraries\\\\nDrex\\\\nFinal Project\\\\nIntroduction To Near Ecosystem (8 Hours)\\\\nWhat is Near?\\\\nPractical\\\\nTech Stack\\\\nNear Infrastructure & Tooling (48 Hours)\\\\nTooling\\\\nFinal project\\\\nRust I (96 hours)\\\\nIntroduction to Rust and Development Environment\\\\nBasic Rust Concepts\\\\nOwnership and References\\\\nBasic Data Structures\\\\nEnums and Pattern Matching\\\\nError Handling\\\\nProgramming in Rust\\\\nBasic Concurrency\\\\nFile Handling and Input/Output\\\\nObject-Oriented Programming in Rust\\\\nSafe and Efficient Programming\\\\nRust for Command Line Application (CLI) Development\\\\nTesting and Documentation\\\\nPackage Publishing and Dependency Management\\\\nRust and Performance\\\\nIntegration with Other Languages\\\\nFinal Project\\\\nRust II - Advanced Rust (64 Hours)\\\\nRust for Parallel and Distributed Computing\\\\nAdvanced Concurrency\\\\nAdvanced Traits and Generics\\\\nMetaprogramming with Macros\\\\nAdvanced Error Handling\\\\nAdvanced I/O and Asynchronous Programming\\\\nUnsafe Rust\\\\nAdvanced Testing and Benchmarking\\\\nFinal Project\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "vianftbrasil.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "16000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Other", "Bounty"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 124497017}

Selected students receive daily transportation and snacks throughout the course. For this, we rely on donations and investments from private companies, not only in capital but also in materials for use in the classroom or for students who cannot afford the basics to maintain their studies at home.\\\\n\\\\nClasses throughout the program are in-person, with the addition of online classes, lectures, attending events, hackathons, immersions, visits to technology companies, innovation fostering, workshops, and more.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### 3.2 Class Journey\\\\n\\\\nMethodology\\\\n\\\\nOnline Classes\\\\n\\\\na) Recorded classes lasting 60 to 90 minutes, focusing on the modules of the subjects presented in the educational journey of the Partner formation. These classes will initially be stored in an unlisted YouTube channel and later on a platform that we are in the process of choosing for hosting. These classes will be accessible to students at any time for review or to revisit the steps presented there.\\\\n\\\\nb) Weekly masterclasses for addressing doubts and deepening the material. These masterclasses will be live with teachers who are experts in the subject.\\\\n\\\\nc) AI mentor will be fed with the content of our course and constantly updated with curated material from our team.\\\\n\\\\nd) Specific areas will be created on the Near Brasil Discord server for the students and their tasks, supported by our team and AI mentor.\\\\n\\\\ne) Bi-weekly masterclasses of 60 minutes with extra challenges for students who wish to deepen their understanding of the subject.\\\\n\\\\nf) File repository with exercise solutions and extra material curated by our team.\\\\n\\\\nFace-to-face classes\\\\n\\\\na) The face-to-face classes will be held in our classroom space with a capacity of up to 25 students. The space includes 25 machines, high-speed internet access, and a smart board.\\\\n\\\\nb) Classes will take place from Tuesday to Friday during an 8-month journey for this group, in the afternoon from 2 PM to 5 PM.\\\\n\\\\nc) All teaching materials will be created by partner team based on Near materials, combined with pedagogical methodology developed by Partner.\\\\n\\\\nd) AI mentor will be fed with the content of our course and constantly updated with curated material from our team.\\\\n\\\\ne) Specific areas will be created on the Near Brasil Discord server for the students and their tasks, supported by our team and our AI mentor.\\\\n\\\\nf) Bi-weekly masterclasses of 60 minutes with extra challenges for students who wish to deepen their understanding of the subject.\\\\n\\\\ng) File repository with exercise solutions and extra material curated by our team.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n#### Partner Academy - Near Journey\\\\n\\\\nIntroduction to Blockchain\\\\nBlockchain Fundamentals\\\\nWeb3 Development Tools and Libraries\\\\nDrex\\\\nFinal Project\\\\nIntroduction To Near Ecosystem (8 Hours)\\\\nWhat is Near?\\\\nPractical\\\\nTech Stack\\\\nNear Infrastructure & Tooling (48 Hours)\\\\nTooling\\\\nFinal project\\\\nRust I (96 hours)\\\\nIntroduction to Rust and Development Environment\\\\nBasic Rust Concepts\\\\nOwnership and References\\\\nBasic Data Structures\\\\nEnums and Pattern Matching\\\\nError Handling\\\\nProgramming in Rust\\\\nBasic Concurrency\\\\nFile Handling and Input/Output\\\\nObject-Oriented Programming in Rust\\\\nSafe and Efficient Programming\\\\nRust for Command Line Application (CLI) Development\\\\nTesting and Documentation\\\\nPackage Publishing and Dependency Management\\\\nRust and Performance\\\\nIntegration with Other Languages\\\\nFinal Project\\\\nRust II - Advanced Rust (64 Hours)\\\\nRust for Parallel and Distributed Computing\\\\nAdvanced Concurrency\\\\nAdvanced Traits and Generics\\\\nMetaprogramming with Macros\\\\nAdvanced Error Handling\\\\nAdvanced I/O and Asynchronous Programming\\\\nUnsafe Rust\\\\nAdvanced Testing and Benchmarking\\\\nFinal Project\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "vianftbrasil.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "16000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "author_id": "vianftbrasil.near", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

{"body": {"name": "Build Events Integrations", "summary": "This project aims to apply Build DAO\\\\\\'s existing event widgets to meet the needs of DevHub\\\\\\'s events committee and the NEAR community. This may involve developing a simple user interface for creating and managing events, automatically generating events upon proposal approval, and/or exploring integration opportunities with other ecosystem projects.\\\\n\\\\nWe hope to start an open forum to understand what will be most beneficial in order to support decentralized event planning and coordination.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "**This is initially being posted as a draft proposal to share what features are readily available, and our intention to support projects within the ecosystem although prioritizing the needs of the Events Committee.** \\\\n\\\\n**This proposal may be split into multiple milestones/proposals in order to statisfy the desires and requirements of any potential stakeholders.**\\\\n\\\\n### Background\\\\n\\\\nSince the [original Calendar widget](https://near.social/#/evrything.near/widget/Calendar) was first built in April 2023, it has been iterated upon and integrated into Build DAO\\\\\\'s gateway, receiving contributions from @itexpert120-contra.near, @megha19.near, @sloppydev.near, and @efiz.near. It was a core feature in [event.app.create](https://devfolio.co/projects/eventsappcreate-ebe8) submitted to ETH Denver 2024 hackathon for [NEAR\\\\\\'s \\\\\\\"Web3 native event platform\\\\\\\" track](https://ethdenver2024.devfolio.co/prizes?partner=NEAR), and has been used to organize @nearbuilders.near events for Consensus 2024 in Austin, TX. \\\\n\\\\nSee it live at [nearbuilders.org](https://www.nearbuilders.org/builddao.near/widget/Index?page=activity&tab=events), or inspect the widget directly [here](https://near.social/builddao.near/widget/components.events.Calendar).\\\\n\\\\n![events app](https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreiaeek4wwq7ygbaxxipesgo5lmoygi7vvemjayzhbibqlkqrylnoly)\\\\n\\\\n### Existing Features\\\\n\\\\n* Calendar month and list view modes\\\\n* Create event with title, description, link, time and date, specify organizers, location, tags, cover image\\\\n* Filter by date, title, location, organizers, and tags\\\\n* Supports recurring events\\\\n* Add to Google Calendar\\\\n* Theming with both light & dark modes\\\\n\\\\n### Design\\\\n\\\\nWe have existing designs by @ceciliavlso.near which include some features that have not yet been implemented, such as search, improved event previewing, and attendance recording. These designs may be improved upon depending on the desired functionalities. \\\\n\\\\n[View Figma Design](https://www.figma.com/design/ZVfCNEHuD7tZKFmod3pjnh/Build-DAO---UX%2FUI-Design?node-id=3671-204539&t=MeWUj1kVC7uErAR9-0)\\\\n\\\\n### Potential Use Cases & Integration Points\\\\n\\\\n* Ecosystem-wide events browser (historically, @nearweek.near calendar)\\\\n* @events-committee.near event review and management, automatic event creation on proposal approval, white label proposal and calendar product\\\\n* [Hackbox](https://taikai.network/en/hackbox/about) hackathon calendar and viewer, potential exploration into [BOS-native hackathon platform](https://near.social/#/buildbox.near/widget/app)\\\\n* @devhub.near community add-on to display call schedules\\\\n* [Keypom](https://keypom.xyz/) events ticketing @keypom.near\\\\n* Customizable, dedicated events pages (similiar to [Partiful](https://partiful.com/) or [Luma](https://lu.ma/home)) deployed to [web4](https://github.com/vgrichina/web4) @web4.near\\\\n* Personal calendars, scheduling assistants, office hours\\\\n* Support for [Bitte](https://bitte.ai/)\\\\\\'s [Dynamic Minsta: Badge Evolution for Multi-Event Participation Bounty](https://github.com/Mintbase/templates/blob/main/bounties/dynamic_minsta.md) \\\\n* @sharddog.near mints, event/marketing analytics\\\\n* @rc-dao.near local event planning and coordination\\\\n* Public good open standards and sdks for easy event integrations in order to promote interoperability across the ecosystem and provide a helping hand to projects looking to break into the event space.\\\\n\\\\n### Technical Considerations\\\\n\\\\nCurrently, the calendar and it\\\\\\'s functionality is implemented entirely with widgets, accessing the calendar itself though an iframe loading [FullCalendar.js](https://fullcalendar.io/). While this version is already built and working, it may be worth considering migrating this code to a more conventional framework, while still maintaining its ability to be embedded in a BOS app and/or deployed to web4. This would depend on the desired functionalities and the expected committment to delivering a robust, maintainable application. \\\\n\\\\nAnother consideration is where and how the event data is stored. Events are currently stored under the creator\\\\\\'s account in the [social-db](https://github.com/NearSocial/social-db) (social.near), and every event created by anyone appears on the calendar unless specifically filtered, using the contract\\\\\\'s \\\\\\\"get\\\\\\\" function (no indexer). This could be replaced with a dedicated contract and/or indexer, although the permissionless, personal namespacing of the social contract may be advantageous. Of course, a hybrid approach may also be appropriate and custom integrations should be welcome.\\\\n\\\\nIn any case, the current widgets can be embedded into any framework via the [near-bos-webcomponent](https://github.com/NEARBuilders/near-bos-webcomponent), and the methods to read or write to the social-db are accessible in any node environment by using the [near-social-js](https://github.com/NEARBuilders/near-social-js) SDK.\\\\n\\\\nDifferent requirements may require different solutions, and these considerations can always be revisited in later milestones after delivering a working MVP using what already exists.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Call to Action\\\\n\\\\nPlease, if any of this seems worthwhile, comment your support, your requirements, or your intention to get involved. We\\\\\\'re seeking active engagement from the NEAR community to shape this project. Here are specific ways you can contribute:\\\\n\\\\n1. **Feature Prioritization**: Comment on which features you believe are most critical and why.\\\\n2. **Use Case Feedback**: If you\\\\\\'re involved with any of the mentioned potential use cases, please share your specific requirements or how you envision using something. How can we help relieve your backlog?\\\\n3. **Technical Input**: For developers, we welcome your thoughts on the technical considerations mentioned, particularly regarding data storage, contract solutions, and framework choices.\\\\n4. **Integration Opportunities**: If you represent a project or initiative that could benefit from event integration, please outline your needs and how you\\\\\\'d like to collaborate. If you have other needs, feel free to share them.\\\\n5. **User Experience Insights**: Share any pain points you\\\\\\'ve experienced with existing event management tools that this project could address.\\\\n6. **Volunteer Your Skills**: If you have relevant skills (development, design, project management) and would like to contribute, please indicate your area of expertise and what you\\\\\\'d like to offer.\\\\n7. **Be a User!**: Express your support and intention to use a solution, and be a part of our initial testing groups once we have a prototype ready. \\\\n\\\\nYour insights are crucial in ensuring these integrations meet the needs of the NEAR community. ", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "nearbuilders.nea", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "TBD", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "NEAR"}, "labels": ["Hackathon", "Bounty"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 125233667}

{"body": {"name": "Build Events Integrations", "summary": "This project aims to apply Build DAO\\\\\\'s existing event widgets to meet the needs of DevHub\\\\\\'s events committee and the NEAR community. This may involve developing a simple user interface for creating and managing events, automatically generating events upon proposal approval, and/or exploring integration opportunities with other ecosystem projects.\\\\n\\\\nWe hope to start an open forum to understand what will be most beneficial in order to support decentralized event planning and coordination.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "**This is initially being posted as a draft proposal to share what features are readily available, and our intention to support projects within the ecosystem although prioritizing the needs of the Events Committee.** \\\\n\\\\n**This proposal may be split into multiple milestones/proposals in order to statisfy the desires and requirements of any potential stakeholders.**\\\\n\\\\n### Background\\\\n\\\\nSince the [original Calendar widget](https://near.social/#/evrything.near/widget/Calendar) was first built in April 2023, it has been iterated upon and integrated into Build DAO\\\\\\'s gateway, receiving contributions from @itexpert120-contra.near, @megha19.near, @sloppydev.near, and @efiz.near. It was a core feature in [event.app.create](https://devfolio.co/projects/eventsappcreate-ebe8) submitted to ETH Denver 2024 hackathon for [NEAR\\\\\\'s \\\\\\\"Web3 native event platform\\\\\\\" track](https://ethdenver2024.devfolio.co/prizes?partner=NEAR), and has been used to organize @nearbuilders.near events for Consensus 2024 in Austin, TX. \\\\n\\\\nSee it live at [nearbuilders.org](https://www.nearbuilders.org/builddao.near/widget/Index?page=activity&tab=events), or inspect the widget directly [here](https://near.social/builddao.near/widget/components.events.Calendar).\\\\n\\\\n![events app](https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreiaeek4wwq7ygbaxxipesgo5lmoygi7vvemjayzhbibqlkqrylnoly)\\\\n\\\\n### Existing Features\\\\n\\\\n* Calendar month and list view modes\\\\n* Create event with title, description, link, time and date, specify organizers, location, tags, cover image\\\\n* Filter by date, title, location, organizers, and tags\\\\n* Supports recurring events\\\\n* Add to Google Calendar\\\\n* Theming with both light & dark modes\\\\n\\\\n### Design\\\\n\\\\nWe have existing designs by @ceciliavlso.near which include some features that have not yet been implemented, such as search, improved event previewing, and attendance recording. These designs may be improved upon depending on the desired functionalities. \\\\n\\\\n[View Figma Design](https://www.figma.com/design/ZVfCNEHuD7tZKFmod3pjnh/Build-DAO---UX%2FUI-Design?node-id=3671-204539&t=MeWUj1kVC7uErAR9-0)\\\\n\\\\n### Potential Use Cases & Integration Points\\\\n\\\\n* Ecosystem-wide events browser (historically, @nearweek.near calendar)\\\\n* @events-committee.near event review and management, automatic event creation on proposal approval, white label proposal and calendar product\\\\n* [Hackbox](https://taikai.network/en/hackbox/about) hackathon calendar and viewer, potential exploration into [BOS-native hackathon platform](https://near.social/#/buildbox.near/widget/app)\\\\n* @devhub.near community add-on to display call schedules\\\\n* [Keypom](https://keypom.xyz/) events ticketing @keypom.near\\\\n* Customizable, dedicated events pages (similiar to [Partiful](https://partiful.com/) or [Luma](https://lu.ma/home)) deployed to [web4](https://github.com/vgrichina/web4) @web4.near\\\\n* Personal calendars, scheduling assistants, office hours\\\\n* Support for [Bitte](https://bitte.ai/)\\\\\\'s [Dynamic Minsta: Badge Evolution for Multi-Event Participation Bounty](https://github.com/Mintbase/templates/blob/main/bounties/dynamic_minsta.md) \\\\n* @sharddog.near mints, event/marketing analytics\\\\n* @rc-dao.near local event planning and coordination\\\\n* Public good open standards and sdks for easy event integrations in order to promote interoperability across the ecosystem and provide a helping hand to projects looking to break into the event space.\\\\n\\\\n### Technical Considerations\\\\n\\\\nCurrently, the calendar and it\\\\\\'s functionality is implemented entirely with widgets, accessing the calendar itself though an iframe loading [FullCalendar.js](https://fullcalendar.io/). While this version is already built and working, it may be worth considering migrating this code to a more conventional framework, while still maintaining its ability to be embedded in a BOS app and/or deployed to web4. This would depend on the desired functionalities and the expected committment to delivering a robust, maintainable application. \\\\n\\\\nAnother consideration is where and how the event data is stored. Events are currently stored under the creator\\\\\\'s account in the [social-db](https://github.com/NearSocial/social-db) (social.near), and every event created by anyone appears on the calendar unless specifically filtered, using the contract\\\\\\'s \\\\\\\"get\\\\\\\" function (no indexer). This could be replaced with a dedicated contract and/or indexer, although the permissionless, personal namespacing of the social contract may be advantageous. Of course, a hybrid approach may also be appropriate and custom integrations should be welcome.\\\\n\\\\nIn any case, the current widgets can be embedded into any framework via the [near-bos-webcomponent](https://github.com/NEARBuilders/near-bos-webcomponent), and the methods to read or write to the social-db are accessible in any node environment by using the [near-social-js](https://github.com/NEARBuilders/near-social-js) SDK.\\\\n\\\\nDifferent requirements may require different solutions, and these considerations can always be revisited in later milestones after delivering a working MVP using what already exists.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Call to Action\\\\n\\\\nPlease, if any of this seems worthwhile, comment your support, your requirements, or your intention to get involved. We\\\\\\'re seeking active engagement from the NEAR community to shape this project. Here are specific ways you can contribute:\\\\n\\\\n1. **Feature Prioritization**: Comment on which features you believe are most critical and why.\\\\n2. **Use Case Feedback**: If you\\\\\\'re involved with any of the mentioned potential use cases, please share your specific requirements or how you envision using something. How can we help relieve your backlog?\\\\n3. **Technical Input**: For developers, we welcome your thoughts on the technical considerations mentioned, particularly regarding data storage, contract solutions, and framework choices.\\\\n4. **Integration Opportunities**: If you represent a project or initiative that could benefit from event integration, please outline your needs and how you\\\\\\'d like to collaborate. If you have other needs, feel free to share them.\\\\n5. **User Experience Insights**: Share any pain points you\\\\\\'ve experienced with existing event management tools that this project could address.\\\\n6. **Volunteer Your Skills**: If you have relevant skills (development, design, project management) and would like to contribute, please indicate your area of expertise and what you\\\\\\'d like to offer.\\\\n7. **Be a User!**: Express your support and intention to use a solution, and be a part of our initial testing groups once we have a prototype ready. \\\\n\\\\nYour insights are crucial in ensuring these integrations meet the needs of the NEAR community. ", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "nearbuilders.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "NEAR"}, "labels": ["Bounty", "Hackathon"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 125234069}

{"data": {"events-committee.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"We have just received a new *Bounty* proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**By**: @efiz.near\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Title**: \\\\u{201c}Build Events Integrations\\\\u{201c}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Summary**:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThis project aims to apply Build DAO\\\\\\'s existing event widgets to meet the needs of DevHub\\\\\\'s events committee and the NEAR community. This may involve developing a simple user interface for creating and managing events, automatically generating events upon proposal approval, and/or exploring integration opportunities with other ecosystem projects.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nWe hope to start an open forum to understand what will be most beneficial in order to support decentralized event planning and coordination.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=31)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

{"body": {"name": "Hackbox Event Report - HacherHouse EthBrussels 2024", "summary": "Near DevHub\\\\\\'s Hacker House aimed to provide a collaborative and innovative environment for participants of the Eth Global Hackathon Brussels 2024. Over the course of 40 hours, participants had access to a well-equipped venue, expert mentorship, and networking opportunities, fostering a sense of community and facilitating the creation of groundbreaking projects.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "**1. Hacker House Overview**\\\\n\\\\nOriginal proposal: https://dev.near.org/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=9&timestamp=1717752295234798083\\\\n\\\\nDate & Format: Friday to Sunday, July 12th to 14th\\\\n\\\\nLocation: Come&Stay Airbnb, 10 minutes away from EthGlobal venue\\\\n\\\\n**2. Event Impact**\\\\n\\\\nThe Near DevHub Hacker House was a logistical success, providing an ideal environment for participants to hack during the EthGlobal Hackathon. While we didn\\\\\\'t meet our initial target of 50 participants, we had a dedicated group of 16 attendees on the first day and 9 on the second day. Despite the lower-than-expected turnout, those who participated expressed high satisfaction with the venue, catering, and overall support provided.\\\\n\\\\nParticipants benefited from expert mentorship, high-quality technical infrastructure, and seamless logistics, which contributed to a conducive atmosphere for project development. The intimate group size allowed for more personalized mentorship and stronger community bonds. Feedback highlighted the value of having a dedicated space to focus on their projects, reinforcing the positive impact of the event.\\\\n\\\\n**3. Hacker House Format**\\\\n\\\\nThe Hacker House was designed to maximize productivity and collaboration among participants. Key features included:\\\\n\\\\n- Open Workspaces: Large, open areas with ample seating and power outlets to facilitate team collaboration.\\\\n- Meeting Areas: Designated spaces for team discussions, mentor sessions, and presentations.\\\\n- Catering Bar: A dedicated area for meals and snacks, ensuring participants remained energized throughout the night. - Resting Zones: Comfortable rooms and beds for participants to recharge during breaks.\\\\n\\\\nStatistics and Impact\\\\n\\\\n- Venue Setup Completion: 100% readiness 12 hours before event start\\\\n- Catering Timeliness: 95% on-time delivery rate\\\\n- Technical Infrastructure Uptime: 99%\\\\n- Average Check-In Time: Less than 5 minutes per participant\\\\n- Gender Distribution: 55% Male - 40% Female - 5% Non-Binary/Other\\\\n\\\\n**4. Financial Summary**\\\\n\\\\nTotal amaunt requested initially: 15,122\\\\n\\\\nVenue Rental: \\\\u{20ac}5550\\\\nCity Tax: \\\\u{20ac}120\\\\nCatering Services: \\\\u{20ac}598.65\\\\nCrypto to fiat + Wise Transfer commisions: \\\\u{20ac}94.4\\\\n\\\\nTotal in Euros: 6,363.05\\\\nTotal in Dollars: 6,927.77\\\\n\\\\nEvent Logistics: $3,500\\\\nTeam Extra: $350\\\\n\\\\n**Total spent in dollars: 10,777.77**\\\\n\\\\n**Budget surplus: 2037 USD + 2308 USDT = 4345 USD(T)**\\\\n*Budget surplus has been sent already to Jose Couto following the decision from the Events Committee\\\\n\\\\n**5. Participant Feedback**\\\\n\\\\n**Venue:**\\\\n- Perfect for collaboration and concentrating on idea development, also resting.\\\\n- It was comfortable and we were grateful for this space during the hackathon\\\\n- Everything ran smoothly, from check-in to internet\\\\n\\\\n**Catering:**\\\\n- The food was excellent and always on time\\\\n- Better coffee and midnight snacks than the main venue.\\\\n\\\\n**6. What went well:**\\\\n\\\\n- Timing for retrieving funds to secure and pay venue on time\\\\n- Communication with House during minor and big problems that happened, managing to solve them on time before the arrival of participants\\\\n- The logistics team managed the event efficiently, ensuring a smooth operation and experience for all participants.\\\\n- Presence and guidance from mentors for the hacking teams\\\\n- Estimated Budget management according expected number of participants vs the actual number of attendees.\\\\n- Exclusive and distinctive Hacker House swag for participants.\\\\n\\\\n**What we can do better:**\\\\n\\\\n- Adjust Luma registration to increase the number of conversions of people who show up at the Hacker House\\\\n- Repeat the Hacker House experience BEFORE an EthGlobal Hackathon, this way we can provide small bounties and other incentives for people to get acquainted with NEAR and the actual tracks of the main hackathon.\\\\n- Pre-Event NEAR Info Sessions: Prepare participants thoroughly for the hackathon.\\\\n\\\\n**7. Photos**\\\\n\\\\nhttps://drive.google.com/drive/folders/12xtWVecN_nM8bhTOAm7kfZJi57rWl6Ge?usp=drive_link\\\\n\\\\n**8. Future Plans**\\\\n\\\\nOverall, while the attendance numbers did not meet our projections, the event succeeded in delivering a valuable and satisfying experience for those who attended, demonstrating the potential for future Hacker House events with enhanced promotional efforts.\\\\n\\\\nPlans for November should be arranged during EthGlobal Denver.", "linked_proposals": [9], "receiver_account": "iamwal.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": ["Hackbox"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 125253631}
